title: So you nerf Elise, Riot?
body:
Elise is already SLOW as hell, and nerfing her movement speed is already ridiculous while Lee is allowed to be as strong as he is. Why do Annie, Morgana, Twitch, Malphite, and others have better MS than she does? Is nerfing her to the movement speed of Zyra and Sona really the best thing to do?

No! Riot, you know how she's been so strong lately? Because of the movement speed on Runic Echoes. **It has +10% movement speed**. Nerf that, not Elise.  If you nerf it after you nerf her, then compensate her back, not leave her gutted like you have so many times to her and other champions already (ex, Sejauni, who you nerfed when she was strong with Cinderhulk, then you nerfed Cinderhulk and never compensated her).

Now my rant is over. Hopefully Riot will listen.

Cinderhulk no, Runeglaive maybe. The reason you only ever saw Sej and Gragas as OP during CInderhulk time was because there was no point abusing it with other tanks while they existed. Most tanks were too strong in the jungle with that item, but they weren't as strong as Sej/Grag so they didn't get played. You could also tell Cinderhulk was a bit much because most AD bruisers started building the tank item rather than their own item regularly - even Cinderhulk Evelynn existed.

Runeglaive did basically get nerfed because of one abuse case but they did at least try to compensate for that by making it stronger in clearing the jungle, so it's meh. In any case, Elise being too strong with Runic Echoes isn't an abuse case like mid Ez was, it's just a champion being a bit too strong, so there's no reason to prioritise nerfing the item over her.

I know that Runic Echoes made Elise very strong, and I know that she'll be building it in at least ninety percent of her jungle games since none of the other enchantments fit well with her. I think that it's a good item, and while I'm not sure how overtuned it is, I think that if it it's going to be part of her kit in at least 90% of games, they should balance her like it's part of her kit. If she'll be overpowered with an item that she buys in most of her games but the item does not affect break most other champions, then it is a better idea to nerf the champion than the item. Luden's Echo was a luxury buy on her jungle before, but now that she will be building Runic Echoes almost every game because it's her jungle item, I think that it is appropriate to balance her using that item.
HOWEVER
This does not account for her laning. Her top and mid lane (and support, if you play that <.<) will be substantially nerfed because of this, especially since she stays in human form for the majority of laning phase and only changes into spider form to finish trades, escape, and execute people. She also does not build Luden's Echo every game as a laner, and so lane Elise will be slow as heck.
I got my level five on Elise primarily through top laning as her, so this is going to hurt. I'm not especially happy with the change, but I can understand Riot's rationale.
